Class ChangeMaking_2

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChangeMaking_2

  • public class ChangeMaking_2
extends java.lang.Object
    Classical Change making problem with an unlimited amount of coins of each type.
    Version 2: Selection function with more elaborated policy: First biggest-coin.
    Depending on the type of coins, it can lead to an optimal solution.
    The class encapsulates all the functions of the Greedy schema

      Given a current solution that is not a final solution, this function selects the new candidate to be added to it.
      The policy followed is more elaborated: Pick the biggest non-discarded type of coin.

      How accurate it is the change.

      Given a current solution, this function states whether it is a final solution or it can still be improved.
      To determine it, it checks whether there is (at least) one more coin that can be used as part of the change.

      Given a current solution and a selected candidate, this function states whether the candidate must be added to the solution or discarded.
      MyList<java.lang.Integer> solve(MyList<java.lang.Integer> coinValues, int amount)
      Given an instance of the GP1 problem, this function solves it using a greedy algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • displayElements

        public void displayElements(MyList<java.lang.Integer> m)
        Given a concrete MyList, this function displays its elements by screen (if any).
        Parameters:
        m: - The MyList we want to display its elements.

      • getCandidate

        public int getCandidate(int changeGenerated,
                        MyList<java.lang.Integer> discarded,
                        MyList<java.lang.Integer> coinValues)
        Given a current solution that is not a final solution, this function selects the new candidate to be added to it.
        The policy followed is more elaborated: Pick the biggest non-discarded type of coin.
        Parameters:
        changeGenerated: - The quantity of change we have generated so far.
        discarded: - The MyList stating whether a candidate has been discarded so far or not.
        coinValues: - A MyList containing the value of each type of coin supported.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(MyList<java.lang.Integer> coinValues,
                       int amount,
                       int changeGenerated,
                       int itemSelected)
        Given a current solution and a selected candidate, this function states whether the candidate must be added to the solution or discarded.
        Parameters:
        coinValues: - A MyList containing the value of each type of coin supported.
        amount: - The amount of change we want to generate.
        changeGenerated: - The quantity of change we have generated so far.
        itemSelected: - The index of the candidate selected.

      • isFinal

        public boolean isFinal(int changeGenerated,
                       MyList<java.lang.Integer> discarded,
                       MyList<java.lang.Integer> coinValues,
                       int amount)
        Given a current solution, this function states whether it is a final solution or it can still be improved.
        To determine it, it checks whether there is (at least) one more coin that can be used as part of the change.
        Parameters:
        changeGenerated: - The change generated by the current solution.
        discarded: - The MyList stating whether a candidate has been discarded so far or not.
        coinValues: - The MyList containing the set of coins supported.
        amount: - The amount of change we want to generate.

      • getQuality

        public MyList<java.lang.Integer> getQuality(MyList<java.lang.Integer> sol,
                                            int changeGenerated,
                                            int amount)
        Given the final solution to the problem, this function computes its value according to:
        How many coins are used in the solution.
        How accurate it is the change.
        Parameters:
        sol: - The MyList containing the solution to the problem.
        changeGenerated: - The change generated by the current solution.
        amount: - The amount of change we want to generate.

      • solve

        public MyList<java.lang.Integer> solve(MyList<java.lang.Integer> coinValues,
                                       int amount)
        Given an instance of the GP1 problem, this function solves it using a greedy algorithm.
        Parameters:
        coinValues: - A MyList containing the value of each type of coin supported.
        amount: - The amount of change we want to generate.
